intro: Osmorhiza brevistylis, commonly known as the short-styled angelica, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant features a thick, fleshy root system and compound leaves with a fern-like appearance. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Osmorhiza brevistylis is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
